ndz_document.ndz_title: On-Axis Field Due to a Current Loop
ndz_document.ndz_abstract: This simple formula uses the law of Biot Savart, integrated over a circular current loop to obtain the magnetic field at any point along the axis of the loop.

ndz_image.name: currloop
ndz_image.alt: Axial field due to a current loop

ndz_image.name: equation1
ndz_image.alt: Axial field due to a current loop

ndz_section.p: B is the magnetic field, in teslas, at any point on the axis of a current loop. The direction of the field is perpendicular to the plane of the loop.
μo is the permeability constant (1.26x10-6 H/m)
i is the current in the wire, in amperes.
r is the radius of the current loop, in meters.
x is the distance, on axis, from the center of the current loop to the location where the magnetic field is calculated, in meters.
